Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2009 05:35PM DebzNY wrote: Hi Deborah- The waiting game with all the testing is the hardest part of all.  You are not alone with the stress level you are feeling.  We all know the anxiety it causes which leads to lack of sleep and appetitie.  Xanex will help smoothe the edges.  My suggestion about your husband is .......Include him in your appointments.  Let him hear what you are being told.  I did this with mine and he handled things much better when he was part of the process.  He turned out to be my "Rock" ....not to mention a second pair of ears is needed with all this information to process. I took xanex for a short period of time during all of my testing.  I definately took it the day of my stereotactic and it helped .  I am sorry you have to go through any of this but you have come to the right place.  These boards have the most amazing people you will ever meet in your life.  They will embrace you and give you the inner strength you never knew you had.  They are filled with knowledge, love and understanding..... Gentle hugs my friend.... Debbie

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2008 08:08AM DebzNY wrote: Shells: You must "WRITE" a letter of appeal!  You have 3 letters of appeal as protocol goes in Insurance world.  Then the next step is arbitration! The insurance company will never pay the money to go to court to arbitrate!  You have to give as much information as possible in your letter.  Have a letter attached from your doctor explaining the reason for clarification with an MRI.  Also...use words like you feel your insurance company is discrimating because you are not following their protocol of necessity.  Flood your letter with attachments from articles showing support for lumps being felt, density of breasts yada yada yada.  Also include as many articles as you can why MRI's are approved for many patients.  This is an on going battle.  They would rather approve a biopsy than an MRI. DO NOT GIVE UP ON THIS.  The only one keeping their money is the insurance company.  I just wrote a letter of appeal for my girlfriend and won her right for an MRI.  Her insurance actually had some ridiculous clause in it stating...TWO members of her family needed to have a positive pathology in order to approve a breast MRI.  Meanwhile she had two areas of concern showing on ultra sound and mammo.  We fight like hell and won.  Her sister has breast cancer and we threatent to sue them for denying her.  We also flooded the letter with many attachments.  Happy to report..she got her MRI and thankfully she is fine! Be that squeeky wheel.  Good luck! Debz
